message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SE 

This paper focuses on the intersection of blockchain technology and the Internet of Things (IoT), which suggests that it could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): This sub-category is the most likely because the paper discusses security and trust issues in current IoT platform solutions and proposes a hybrid blockchain architecture to address these issues. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): This sub-category is also likely because the paper discusses the requirement of achieving distributed consensus in IoT and proposes a decentralized system of cooperating smart objects. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): This sub-category is likely because the paper focuses on the Internet of Things and proposes a blockchain-based architecture for IoT. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): This sub-category is less likely but still possible because the paper discusses the formation of PoW sub-blockchains and proposes guidelines based on dimensions, metrics, and bounds. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): This sub-category is also less likely but possible because the paper proposes a new architecture for IoT and carries out a performance and security evaluation to prove its validity.
